"I saw you were ill-disposed to me," Luzhin said. 

"I am not ill!" Raskolnikov shouted. 

"So much the worse," Luzhin replied, leaving. 

Raskolnikov cursed, "Go to hell!" 

Razumihin shook his head. "How could youâ€”how could you!" 

"Let me alone!" Raskolnikov screamed. "I want to be alone!" 

Zossimov nodded to Razumihin. "Come along." 

"But we can't leave him like this!" Razumihin protested. 

"Come along," Zossimov insisted, heading out. 

Razumihin hesitated, then followed. 

"It might be worse not to obey him," Zossimov said. 

"What's the matter with him?" Razumihin asked. 

"If only he could get some favourable shock," Zossimov sighed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his intense frustration and desire for solitude amidst the tension with Luzhin and concern from his friends.
